results.title: Waterfront safety
results.creator_credit: Western Australia. Dept. of Labour and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description:
This 1966 film takes place on the wharfs and ships at Fremantle Harbour, demonstrating safe working methods for waterside workers. It shows the correct handling of various types of cargo, including logs, grain and phosphate mined from Nauru. It emphasises the use of protective clothing and equipment. The film also shows the prevention and control of fires, including fire fighting ships.

Produced by the Western Australian Government Film Unit and presented by the Western Australian Department of Labour with Accident Prevention Organisation (Shipping).

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Waistlines and lifelines
results.creator_credit: Russell Gibbs, John Banks and Advent Films
results.brief_description: Ron has a weight problem. He tries massage and the crash diet, but to no avail. A heart attack scare sends him to his doctor, who recommends graded exercises and consultation with a dietician.

results.title: The Vision of William Blake (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Guy Brenton, British Film Institute Experimental Film Fund and Morse Films
results.brief_description: Filmed in four museums that contain major collections of Blake’s writings and paintings, this documentary by Guy Brenton explores the anguish of Blake’s prophetic world, Music by Ralph Vaughan Williams, and narration and poems read by Bernard Miles and Robert Speight.

results.title: The unsafe act
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Films and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1965 film dramatises a number of industrial accidents and how to avoid them. The film shows footage of workers in various occupations such as window cleaning, welding and bricklaying, and shows accidents that can occur in these environments. The dramatic voiceover warns against haste, improvisation, carelessness and failure to use safety devices, emphasising that most accidents occur in this way.

Produced by Fortune Films for the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

There are several jumps in the soundtrack throughout the film due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.brief_description: An example of student film production. Presents student activities motivated by popular music, contrasted with the more regimented school assembly. Features Chadstone High School, Melbourne.

results.title: Think twice
results.creator_credit: Norma Disher, Keith Gow, James Levy and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description:
This 1958 film demonstrates the hazards associated with the boilermaking trade. It outlines the dangers of heat, infrared and ultraviolet rays and fumes, which are encountered with oxyacetylene and electric arc welding. It shows how accidents happen with each of these dangers and the types of injury suffered, including burns, eye injury and blindness, and serious illness caused by inhalation of fumes. It also shows how accidental explosions can occur when using welding equipment, and the importance of safe practices when welding, particularly in confined spaces.

The film emphasises the protective gear and equipment recommended at the time that should be used in order to avoid these hazards. It also shows teenage apprentices, some very young, being trained in safety practices. The film takes place at Cockatoo Docks and Engineering Company, a shipbuilding company that operated on Cockatoo Island, Sydney, between 1933 and 1992.

Produced by the Waterside Workers’ Federation of Australia Film Unit and presented by the Boilermakers’ Society of Australia and Protector Safety Products Pty. Ltd. Sydney, Australia.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: T is for Tumbleweed
results.creator_credit: Louis Clyde Stoumen, James A. Lebenthal and Camera Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: Portrays without commentary the racing, creeping, leaping travels of a tumbleweed and the encounters it has with people, animals and things. Photographed by Haskell Wexler.

results.title: Emotions of everyday living: the steps of age
results.creator_credit: Ben Maddow, Helen Levitt and Film Documents
results.brief_description: A discussion of the problems confronting old age. The effect of inactivity on the lives of a crane-driver and his wife after his retirement are shown.

results.title: The Simpson automa-boot
results.brief_description: This film is an amusing animated cartoon made by Form I students from Moorabbin Technical College. It follows the activities of an “automatic boot” which takes the user wherever they may wish to go in a fantasy world. The producer’s aim was to give the students an opportunity for creative work in which cooperation between students, descriptive writing, animation of the human form and self-disclipine would be required. Animation by Colin Jenkins and Andrew Mougemore. Painters - Neil Stevenson, Tony McFarland, Steven Witcraft, Dave Harmo, Emily McPherson, Trevor Williams.

results.title: Sidney Nolan
results.brief_description: Sidney Nolan’s interest in and pre-occupation with Australian history and legend have earned him the affectionate title “The Songman of his tribe”. Nolan’s imaginative and poetic vision is revealed in some 150 paintings. His earliest works and his series on Ned Kelly, Mrs Frazer, Bourke and Wills, the Australian outback, Eureka Stockade, Leda and the swan, and Gallipoli, give a rare insight into the mind and stature of this artist. Also shows the artist at work in his studio.
